time
[Gavren Forest, Path]

Large branches hang down from above, casting dark shadows across the forest floor.  With every rustle of the breeze they seem to take on a life of their own, almost to the point of distracting you from the deep ravine that lies ahead, obscured by the gnarly undergrowth.  A mossy rotting log, a crooked crumbling stone bridge, and a dark path are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: None.
>
Current time is: Wed Nov  3 23:54:15 2004 EST.

It is now 11:50 pm on the 8th day of the 12th month in the year 318.

You have been adventuring for 42 mins, 11 secs this session.

>[Gavren Forest, Path]

Large branches hang down from above, casting dark shadows across the forest floor.  With every rustle of the breeze they seem to take on a life of their own, almost to the point of distracting you from the deep ravine that lies ahead, obscured by the gnarly undergrowth. [Gavren Forest]

This may well be the largest tree you have ever seen. Several luminous flowers hang from it and a sense of well-being seems to pervade the area.  A giant steelwood tree is here.

[Docks.]

A long pier runs along the river here, the warehouse that stands nearby with its doors open sees much use. Of all the piers here along the riverfront, this one seems the busiest. The large majority of the food shipments come through here.  An open wooden door is here.

The area brightens.
[Docks.]

Mud and muck cover the roadway and pier, testament to the high traffic in the area. Men and women unload large cargo ships. Enormous quantities of food come into the city from the docks, and many other goods besides. Goods are moved into the city via the new trade road to the northwest. A pile of lumber stands nearby for future improvements.  A black wooden walkway, an open small oak crate, and an open small oak crate are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Trade Route.]

The riggings and sails of the tall ships lined up against the rise to the southeast. The wall around Spur looms silent and sentinel to the north. Barely discernable in the distance, the plumed helmets of stationed guards bob slowly as they make their circuit of the parapets.

[Trade Route.]

Mud and exposed roots make travel difficult for both man and animal alike. The gentle sounds of the nearby river and the birds overhead are little comfort to those struggling to keep their balance.

[Trade Route.]

The road begins to dry, much to the relief of the weary animals pulling laden carts to market. A burned out field lies to the west, wisps of smoke reaching towards the sky. Several broken wagon wheels lie beside the road.

l
The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

The heavily mired track that left the docks widens out into a maintained thoroughfare carrying the commerce of Spur. Merchants, drovers and tinkers crowd this back road into the city, always under the watchful eyes of the guards standing sentinel on the wall above. The road is the lifeblood of the Spur.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

Trees from the southern end of the Oak Woods protrude around the corner of the giant Spurian city wall to the west. Several workers scrub along the side of the massive wall, trying to clean off the latest graffiti. Warehouses stand between the road and the Darkith, dulling the sounds from the river and the docks.

l
The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

Several San Elves, shackled at the ankles, stand by the road near the corner of the giant city wall. Two guards eye the chain gang carefully, as a harried Usil engineer pores over a set of drawings. Deep ruts have resulted from the persistent erosion. The San actually enjoy this break from their jail time, snickering quietly as they lean on their shovels and pick-axes.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

Tall grasses wave their seed-laden heads in the slightest breeze. Scarred trees bear ancient wounds from wagons wheels and cartage animals. One particular tree bears the marks of hundreds of passers-by. From initials, to messages with dates, the tree marks the passage of time, travel, and the citizens of Spur.  A giant ancient dark steelwood tree is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

An ork scrambles across the road just ahead of you, squeaking in panic. Arrows from above strike the ground at the creature's heels. The shrieking beast reaches the edge of the tree line and ducks easily under the lower branches of an old Beech. Before disappearing into the forest, it releases a final snort. With a wave and a nod, a Firian guard on the city wall indicates the way is clear.

This area is illuminated.

>It looks like an average eagle.

It has a head, 2 legs, and wings.

It appears to be in good shape.
It will be very hard for you to hit and it will be hard for it to hit you!

It is wearing a small gold collar.

l
The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

A trio of Leuian sailors stumble past, returning to the docks. The youngest in the group is being helped along, an arm over each of his partner's shoulders. He mutters something about swabbing decks for the rest of his career. Hearty laughter from the two veterans carries on until the three are out of earshot.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

An acrid stench assails your nose before the source becomes apparent. Something quite large, but definitely dead and half-eaten, lies between two large ravens. Squawking noisily, they compete over the carrion. Muffled growls emanate from the tree-line, and a sudden rustling causes the birds to take flight, leaving their prize behind. Were those golden eyes flashing in the shadows?

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

A Human farm girl waves a carrot in front of a horse, pleading with it to continue up the road. Judging by the size of the load in her cart, she'll need an entire garden to get the tired old mare to market.  Some light red wildflowers are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north south* west northwest.
[Trade Route.]

A Human farm girl waves a carrot in front of a horse, pleading with it to continue up the road. Judging by the size of the load in her cart, she'll need an entire garden to get the tired old mare to market.  Some light red wildflowers are here.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

A bored Flerian, leaning against the city wall, glances at you with hooded eyes as you pass by. He turns and slinks through a small hole at the base of the wall. Beautiful golden grasslands grow in a large clearing to the west.

The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

The city wall stands ominously to the east of the road, an impenetrable mass of stone. Its presence dominates your vision and the road stands in deep, dark shadow until mid-day. Archer towers to the north rise above the top of the wall, indicating the West Gate is near.  A green bush is here.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Trade Route.]

Four draft horses stomp at the ground in annoyance as two miners struggle with the broken wheel of a horse-cart, filled to the top with glittering dark ore. One heavily muscled Hithual curses fluently in Battle as he attempts to leverage the cart with a plank from its own sideboard. The attempt to thread the axle with a new wheel fails, setting off shouts of pain and frustration.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Spur Gateway.]

Travelers from Rathan to the northwest, and the Trade Route to the south, converge at Spur's west gate. Guards posted on the ground give those seeking to enter the city a cursory once-over. Their lack of interest shows that anyone approaching has already been observed from above for some time. A grate in the ground loosens mud from wagon wheels and hooves before they pass through the gate, helping to keep the streets of Spur fairly clean.  An open giant black iron gate, a giant green oak tree, a small blue pool, a thick oak grate over the pool, and a polished stone marker are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north south* southwest west northwest.

Fionna just placed a dragon carved bone hilted broadsword within her medium-sized exquisite steel scabbard.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The path is flanked by countless tall oaks, swaying peacefully in the wind. They do their best to hide the sky from view, making it hard to tell night from day at times. Littering the area are pieces of broken wagon, bits of human remains and dried splotches of blood. The remnants of a violent fight lie all around you, whomever used to belong to the wagon is no more than vulture food.  A bloody severed foot is here.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

In the dusty distance, Spur's great wall demarks the southern end of this well-traveled merchant's road. Soaring majestically to the north stands the spiky pinnacles and snow topped peaks of an epic mountain range so immense that it separates lands, races, and cultures. Connecting the two is a merchant road built long ago.

This area is illuminated.

The eagle opens its hooked beak and as it lets out a shrill screech, the entire area becomes still and quiet.

[West Spur Road.]

The noise and sputum of the big city stains the south eastern horizon through the vague outline of old-growth oaks, maples and cedars. This well traveled road transverses the flat terrain shouldered by weeds and vines and, due to the proximity of the city, small paths continuously cut through the road from either side.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Lush grass grows up to the borders of a thick, dense forest that cloaks the hills to the west. The grasslands thin near the grove as the huge trees completely shade the ground, and are replaced by taller bushes and juniper trees. The contrast between the waving stalks on the flat vista and the dark leaves of almost vertical trees is striking.  A giant dark green decaying wyvern carcass is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st young lean wyvern and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

From the west spans a dark green forest of Sycamore and Beech trees that soak in the moister parts of the lower river valley. The tall, shaded forest breaks like a green tinged wave upon the tranquil calm of the grasslands. The huge trees within are ancient, reaching hundreds of feet into the air. As if steaming from a great cauldron, a heavy ground fog seeps from deep within the forest carrying with it the fresh smell of decomposing green matter.

This area is illuminated.

[West Spur Road.]

Grassy plains stretch out to the west across the wide flat valley broken only by the outline of a dark forest further to the southwest. The huge expanse of waving stalks is home to creatures large and small. Each has adapted to their own niche and are camouflaged from the casual observers gaze.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

A rickety criss-crossed rough beam fence pens the grazing of black and white cows whose ponderous forms are barely visible through the tall grass on either side of the road. To the north, the soft, undulating grassland floor of the wide valley succumbs to the rolling foothills, which in turn delineates the imposing outline of a vista-spanning mountain range. Many a traveler has witnessed this idyllic vantage point and has been drawn on to follow the road that travels into the heart of the mountains.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

Obvious paths: north south*.

The eagle spreads its wings.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The road diverts around a small pool of murky water that lies to the north. A confusion of hoof prints muddies the shoreline where the placid bovines have come to water themselves. The pool is damned by a small hillock which allows no drainage so the pool remains stagnant. The mountains to the north reflect in perfectly upside-down symmetry on the still pond's surface, only wavering slightly in concentric circles to the deft touch of small insects.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The travel-worn road dips and curves around the low lying foothills. Each pass over the top of hillsides presents a new view of the mountain range. Each dip into small valleys reveal minute eco-systems that exist in each wagon wheel rut where water collects. Splayed avion tracks dot the dried mud in random order permanently recording the hunters conquest of lesser things from the mud and moss.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rabid dog and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Aged and splintered into the vague circular shape, a decaying wagon wheel is left to rot in the grass by the roadside. Their roots protectively sheltered from the weather, idiosyntric sprouts of taller grasses thrive haphazardly inside the wheel. Several tiny holes top small pyramids of sandy debris, where a few red fire ants scout their wagon-wheel domain for fodder.

This area is illuminated.

You follow Helios west...


l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

As the road bends around a curve, ruts left by merchant's wagons cut so deeply into the mud that all wheeled vehicles are forced to follow the set path. Four loaded wagons of a merchants caravan stand idle as one larger than standard wagon skitters along the path. The buckboard's frame groans and strains to keep it inline while the driver attempts to negotiate the turn. Four dark maned, matched mules balk at the noise behind them, and stomp nervously over the deep ruts. The liveried caravan guards attempt to haul the mules forward, further adding to the mules stubborn refusal to move.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* northwest.
[West Spur Road.]

As the road bends around a curve, ruts left by merchant's wagons cut so deeply into the mud that all wheeled vehicles are forced to follow the set path. Four loaded wagons of a merchants caravan stand idle as one larger than standard wagon skitters along the path. The buckboard's frame groans and strains to keep it inline while the driver attempts to negotiate the turn. Four dark maned, matched mules balk at the noise behind them, and stomp nervously over the deep ruts. The liveried caravan guards attempt to haul the mules forward, further adding to the mules stubborn refusal to move.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east northwest.
>
You follow Helios northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The road charges across a flat valley through waving stalks of grain with coppery tinted seeds. Around the northern edge grows a row of huge cypress trees with trunks that measure eight feet across. Debris from the trees' self-trimming mats the taller grasses into an impenetrable wall. The cypresses produce the necessary windbreak for the field to bear the heavy headed grain.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The worn merchants road travels the southern side of a low hill in one wide arc. The broad path is slightly banked to accomodate for the turn and incline. On the exposed side of the road, the sturdy road-bed is exposed to the elements and yet has remained solid. A neatly kept plank house with a stone well and fenced paddock overlooks grain fields to the southeast.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Broadening to fill the lee of a wide valley, the roadway passes by several temporary campsites where caravans have bolstered the existing comforts for their temporary encampments. Neat stacks of foraged sticks and axe-hewn firewood sit adjacent to the blackened rocks of two impromptu fire rings. Freshly dug midden pits waft clues to the camp's frequent use into the clean mountain air.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Empty wooden crates, broken harnesses, damaged pottery, and the usual byproducts of food preparation fill an impromptu refuse pile adjacent to two campsites. Both two and four legged scavengers ply through the pile, scattering it further and enlarging the boundary. The result is a landmark of incongruous shapes, colors and shadows along the otherwise bland sweep of grasslands through which the roadway travels.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* northwest.
Helios is in your group.
Timid is in your group.
Fionna is in your group.
Clive is in your group.
Arion is in your group.
Lewelin is in your group.
Your group has 7 people!

Clive just placed a damaged quiver of morbius tipped rosewood arrows within his open large leather quiver satchel.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

Just to the north, the roadway curves gently around a bend in a large river that flows towards the southeast. An enormous smooth round rock splits off a small eddy from the main current resulting a deep, clear pool by the eastern side of the road. The cool calm water catches the reflection of the white snowcapped mountain range further up the valley while the river rushes past towards Spur. Five fishermen recline on folding chairs or against rocks, tethered by the silvery lines of their poles to the fishing hole. Each fisherman is spread evenly around the pool as if held apart by some invisible barrier as they eye the large shadowy fish shapes finning effortlessly against the mild current in the eddy.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The raging silver-cast river cuts through the grassland and heads southeast. Fishing boats, bearing the crest of the city of Spur, dart around several barges laden with exotic wares to trade in the merchant city. Most bear the purple livery of the city of Rathan, but every so often a ship flying unfamiliar colors can be sighted.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rabid dog, the 1st ork, the 1st rogue, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

The area brightens.
[West Spur Road.]

The metal grey river deposits a sandbar on its western bank near the merchant road, causing a snag of dead logs, branches and floating debris. A cat sized rodent, with long teeth, flat tail and webbed toes peaks briefly over the jumbled tangle of branches before dipping back into the frigid water without a splash.

This area is illuminated.

[West Spur Road.]

Built to withstand the constant flooding of the large river, the roadbed here was constructed 3 feet higher then the rest of the valley floor. The competant engineers extended the berm further northwest until it became the footings of a stalwart rock bridge.

l
The area brightens.
[Silver River Bridge.]

The massive stone bridge expands over the raging river, it's huge pilons buried deep in the river's bottom. Within sight and just downstream, the water rushes past what remains of the old bridge, causing dangerous under-currents. Bright red bouys mark the broken fragments locations and signs tell of the peril. The river pilots earn their pay negotiating this treacherous obstacle.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rabid dog and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

Obvious paths: north southeast*.

The area brightens.
[Silver River Bridge.]

The huge stone bridge span was built tall to allow the various merchant ships to pass underneath. This amazing height affords a splendid view of the countryside: from the blur of smoky residential air to the southeast, across the verdant grasslands that cover the foothills, to the majestic peaks of the mountain range to the north.

The area brightens.
[Silver River Bridge.]

The river surges strongly below the stone span. Even from this height, the noise of the flowing water is near deafening. Two small fishing boats nearly collide as they try to tack between the same set of supports. Only skillful sailing prevents them from hitting each other, or the supports.

The area brightens.
[Silver River Bridge.]

In the middle of the stone bridge's span, a carved stone plaque is set into the masonry of the rock wall. Worked black marble bears a likeness of a San Elf and a brief warning describing her and her crimes against the merchants who depend on this bridge for their livelihood.

The area brightens.
[Silver River Bridge.]

Mismatched mortar colors and varying types and cuts of the stone show the extent of the reconstruction made by quick working masons. A few proud workers chiseled their initials and the date into their handiwork, most reading the date of Rinannimas, 6th month, 61st day, year 313. Bright banners flutter in the breeze on both sides of the bridge as if in celebration of it's victory over both the river's truculence and sabotage.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Silver River Bridge.]

A massive stone bridge spans a raging grey tinted river as it runs it's course towards the southeast. The mud around the bridge footings has been churned by wheels of quarry wagons, tracks of sleds bearing block and tackle, shod hooves of draft beasts and booted feet of masons and bridge workers. The newer parts of the huge bridge are obvious due to the contrast in colors of mortar and rock. Bright banners snap briskly in the wind from both ends of the bridge.  A broken wooden wagon is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Withstanding seasonal floods and constant traffic, the durable road shows how affective good design and competent construction can be. It travels a hand paved berm straight to an imposing grey stone bridge to the southeast. The pilons of the bridge are cloaked in river mist as the raging river sweeps by. Only the brightness of the fluttering flags that top the spans stand out sharply.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A brown and white osprey soars above the raging river, scanning the water for a meal. Suddenly, it dives down to the surface and snatches a rather large trout from the water. The trout wriggles helplessly in the large birds grip as it is carried off to a nest of sticks and twigs high in the distant treetops.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

On the northern edge of the road stands a tall, flat rock. Chipped into the shape of a pillar and abraded to smoothness, it bears the stamped surveyor's mark of the road's builder. The mark's grooved letters are filled with sand and dust and obscured from age, but the arrows delineating north, south, east and west are clear and easy to read. The rest of the stamp is undecipherable and lends mystery to the road's origin.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* west.

Clive just removed some jagged crystals from within his open multicolored patched cotton carry-all.
[North Bridge Trail.]

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Boulders stacked in pyramids contained by large timbers stand mutely to the side of the roadway next to an impromptu dump of broken tools, wooden stakes and empty buckets lined with mortar. Deeply grooved sled tracks lead to the east towards the bridge from this part of the road where the flatness of the valley was best suited for the staging area during the bridge's reconstruction. Smooth rectangles of tent foundations still mark their location in a semi circle around a blackened fire ring where the workers and their supervisors lived during it's rebuilding.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* west.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Boulders stacked in pyramids contained by large timbers stand mutely to the side of the roadway next to an impromptu dump of broken tools, wooden stakes and empty buckets lined with mortar. Deeply grooved sled tracks lead to the east towards the bridge from this part of the road where the flatness of the valley was best suited for the staging area during the bridge's reconstruction. Smooth rectangles of tent foundations still mark their location in a semi circle around a blackened fire ring where the workers and their supervisors lived during it's rebuilding.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east west.
>
You follow Helios west...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The decaying remains of the bridge workers camp sprawls across this flat valley. To house their draft beasts, the workers constructed small stalls and shelters from rickety boards nailed quixotically to the standing trees. Three brass ring topped posts lie sunk into the grasslands turf, to the south, which was most likely used for tethering grazing animals. Between the posts is a rough stone trough that is filled automatically with water by a rickety mechanical wind mill, whirling lazily in the breeze.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* northwest.

You follow Helios northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Water loving trees hug the river's course through the low lying valley. Giant beech and huge alders vie for the valuable sodden shoreline and shade the understory bushes and ferns from direct sunlight. The result is a lushly green, verdant forest that obscures the river from the view on the road, though the hiss of rushing water reveals it's course.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lizardman, the 2nd lizardman, the 3rd lizardman, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast* west.
[North Bridge Trail.]

You follow Helios west...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Running parallel to the road is a smooth rock lined trench that channels the road's run-off during rainstorms. This flat part of the road that follows the valley floor would be prone to turn into a muddy bog and therefore a hazard to most caravans and their pack animals. Anticipating this event, the road's engineers built drains into the lower side of the road that carry the runoff into the culvert, which carries it harmlessly down to the low end of the valley.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* west.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Running parallel to the road is a smooth rock lined trench that channels the road's run-off during rainstorms. This flat part of the road that follows the valley floor would be prone to turn into a muddy bog and therefore a hazard to most caravans and their pack animals. l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

With the care and attention to detail rarely given to a mundane project such as a road, the engineers foresaw potential hazards and built the solutions into their finished project. Tracking the southern, downhill side of the road is a stone lined trough meant to solve any flooding or mud related issues.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road passes through a small secluded valley. The soft cadence of rushing water echoes quietly down the vale where the rolling hills of the grasslands meets the sharper cliffs of the foothills. Riverlets and streams trickle down the rock faces adding harmony to a distant river's melody.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The road crests the top of hill overlooking the sweeping grasslands of the river valley. A smokey smudge on the southeastern horizon reveals the location of a large city and the merchant road appears here and there between trees and hills as it travels to market. The roar of the great river drones in the distance.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

White barked birch trees populate the moist valleys that drain into the river to the southeast as the merchant road passes nearby. The tall vertical trees reach to the sky in a beautiful dance reminiscent of dancers waving their arms gracefully to some unheard rhythm. The grain-laden grasses sway in accompaniment, and the tinkling waterfalls and babbling creeks beat like odd syncopated patterns onto the rocks.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast south*.

>[North Bridge Trail.]

White barked birch trees populate the moist valleys that drain into the river to the southeast as the merchant road passes nearby. The tall vertical trees reach to the sky in a beautiful dance reminiscent of dancers waving their arms gracefully to some unheard rhythm. The grain-laden grasses sway in accompaniment, and the tinkling waterfalls and babbling creeks beat like odd syncopated patterns onto the rocks.

This area is illuminated.

In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The roadway takes advantage of a cut in the hill to negotiate a tumbled cliff face. At the top of the hill is a high, flat, steppe grassland, and at the bottom is the edge of the open range. At one point, the road narrows to cross a small stream. Very little mud gathers in the shallows of the stream and the pebbles and rocks glitter like gold as the wagon wheels churn the gravel.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant roads widens as it travels another grass swept plateau. The mountain range fills the northern skyline in stark detail. Huge snow capped peaks and rough faced cliffs are close enough to see the individual boulders, waterfalls, and haphazard game trails. Much higher up the great mountainsides a line where trees stop growing gives testament to the altitude. The air is cool.

This area is illuminated.

A rogue enters, following Helios's group.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The grassland plateau is embraced by a stand of dark green oak trees so thick that little light passes through the profusion of their many lobed leaves. The forest is ancient and the trunks of the trees bare witness to fires, lightning strikes and the attacks of insects. Large gout-like burls disfigure some of the wide, grey trunks which have grown quietly next to the road for hundreds of years.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st rogue.
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast west*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Crunching loudly on the road is a ankle high deposit of acorn hulls and their discarded caps. Quick footed grey squirrels dash across the road, or above on the high intertwined branches of the stately oaks, with the highly coveted acorns grasped firmly in their teeth. The squirrels flash their tails at each other in some unknown signal as traffic passes on the road.  A pile of empty acorn caps is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road makes a wide turn as it passes through the thick oak forest. A tiny meadow with a murmuring creek is the only open spot in sight. Bright wildflowers and fragrant mosses crowd around a sparkling jewel of a pond while the huge oaks stand like sentinels around the edges. A spotted fawn and its doe-eyed mother drink cautiously, swishing their white edged tails quickly.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road follows a bumpy path through the oak forest. Each stately old tree has added a few feet to it's girth since the road was first surveyed and constructed hundreds of years ago. Their roots have plied across the road, upending it's hand laid foundation and hand pounded bed. Several large knees of the oak's roots have leveraged up the edges of the road, hindering all wagons' passage and threatening to break spokes and axles.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Off to the side of the road, perhaps a hundred feet away, stands an enormous tree that commands the attention of all who pass this direction. It's offspring populate the plateau for miles in both directions. At one time, the tree must have stood alone on the prairie soil and dropped acorns year after year until one tree became a huge forest of oaks.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road takes a large bend as it travels through the dark woodland. Venerable, wide-trunked oaks line the merchant road and the trunks of the closest ones have been marked by the passage of thousands of travelers and adventurers. Some have carved their initials, some, a picture of loved ones or body parts of odd proportions, and some, the date they passed by.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The high steppe grasslands yields to a green wall of oak trees to the southeast. The oak forest is very old, the greying trunks of the behemoths are cracked and split. The road immediately darkens under the canopy of the green leaves. Pale green bracken ferns grow tall in the eternal twilight shade. Flat, yellow capped mushrooms and rippled shelf fungi sprout from the fallen trees. The pleasant aroma of healthy decomposing leaves fills the air.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast* west.

You follow Helios west...


l
The area brightens.
[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

Hand pounded concrete pipes, half circle in shape, channel two small streams under the chinked rock and gravel road-bed. The icy spring water bubbles down the hill and glides over a sheet of shorn granite until it fills a crystal clear pool at the bottom, far below the road. The pool's overflow creates a single clear stream that meanders towards the ancient oak forest.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* northwest.
[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

Hand pounded concrete pipes, half circle in shape, channel two small streams under the chinked rock and gravel road-bed. The icy spring water bubbles down the hill and glides over a sheet of shorn granite until it fills a crystal clear pool at the bottom, far below the road. The pool's overflow creates a single clear stream that meanders towards the ancient oak forest.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east northwest.

Fionna flies down and out of sight.

Clive, The Masked Drag-al returns!, just went northwest.

Timid stands up.

Lewelin just went northwest.

Arion asks, "uhh?"
nw
[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

To the southeast, two streams trickle from the north and pass directly under the roadbed. The twin streams combine as they travel down the hill to make a picture-perfect waterfall rimmed by delicate maidenhair ferns and bright green moss. The little riverlet from the pool then flows into an ancient oak forest further southeast.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Clive the Noble Drag-al and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast southeast*.
>
Lewelin is now following Clive.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road swerves around a rock strewn hill. Several ancient oak trees grow in solitary wonder on the south side of the hill. Dead fall and broken branches cover the hollow and is home for a family of thick furred marmots. The dark brown colored rodents stare out of the dark recesses of the dead branches with shiny black eyes. A brace of buck-toothed, adolescent marmots scramble for cover as the shrill cry of a hawk sounds further up the mountain.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast southwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Thicker stalked grasses grow here on this high plateau where the air is rarified and rain spills quickly down the small rocky gullies. A few staunch oaks grow alone or in groups of one or two, their roots exposed where they cling to the rocky soil for sustenance. Thin, scraggly junipers suck up what little moisture the soil does manage to hold. The merchant road placidly passes by, untouched by time in the dry environment.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue, the 2nd rogue, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north southwest*.

You follow Helios north...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Bright green trees and healthy bushes stand out sporadically on the dusty steppe. The little spring fed islands are surrounded by the blue-green grasses that thrive here. All manner of beasts are drawn to the springs and the protection they offer. Bright blue scrub jays chatter noisily among themselves as they dart and swerve in accomplished aerial feats pursuing their winged insect meals. A small herd of wary jackrabbits stop munching the grass to turn their white ears towards the merchant road. The nearest jack to the road stands on his hind legs and tests the air for any scent of their many predators.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast south*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Blending perfectly with the muted hues of the arid surroundings, a lone timber wolf stalks the outer edges of the grassland about a half a mile from the merchant road. The wolf's ears are perked to listen for the rustling of the bushy tailed jack rabbits that thrive in the prairie. The wolf lifts it nose to catch a scent, howls briefly and trots off towards the southeast to catch it's prey from downwind.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Game trails cut back and forth across the merchants road covered with the split, sharp toed hoof prints of deer and elk. Dark spoor mark the trails most frequently used by the herbivores: the hunted. Sharp yipping pierces the cold, quiet air from both sides of the road: the hunters. The widely spaced junipers, scrub oaks, and mountain hawthorns offer ample cover for the pack of wolves to range unseen through the plateau.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

You follow Helios northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A brisk wind barrels down from the mountains to the north, its touch filled with the promise of ice and snow. As it passes the dry road-bed, it mixes with the warm moist air of the river valley that creeps north and causes dust dervishes that spin their opaque bodies thousands of feet into the air. The sharp bladed grasses shiver and swirl as the tiny twisters weave their way across the steppe.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road tops a low swell in the dusty green grass ocean of the dry steppe. From here, it is possible to observe an astounding 360 degree vista of the towering mountains to the north, the thick oak forest to the southeast, and more dry grasslands to the south and west. The terrain buckles and bends towards the north like a giant rug of trees and rocks had been pushed towards a wall of solid rock.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north southwest*.

Dead fall and broken branches cover the hollow and is home for a family of thick furred marmots. The dark brown colored rodents stare out of the dark recesses of the dead branches with shiny black eyes. A brace of buck-toothed, adolescent marmots scramble for cover as the shrill cry of a hawk sounds further up the mountain.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast southwest.
>
You follow Helios southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Twin Creeks Crossing.]

To the southeast, two streams trickle from the north and pass directly under the roadbed. The twin streams combine as they travel down the hill to make a picture-perfect waterfall rimmed by delicate maidenhair ferns and bright green moss. The little riverlet from the pool then flows into an ancient oak forest further southeast.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road swerves around a rock strewn hill. Several ancient oak trees grow in solitary wonder on the south side of the hill. Dead fall and broken branches cover the hollow and is home for a family of thick furred marmots. The dark brown colored rodents stare out of the dark recesses of the dead branches with shiny black eyes. A brace of buck-toothed, adolescent marmots scramble for cover as the shrill cry of a hawk sounds further up the mountain.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Thicker stalked grasses grow here on this high plateau where the air is rarified and rain spills quickly down the small rocky gullies. A few staunch oaks grow alone or in groups of one or two, their roots exposed where they cling to the rocky soil for sustenance. Thin, scraggly junipers suck up what little moisture the soil does manage to hold. The merchant road placidly passes by, untouched by time in the dry environment.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue, the 2nd rogue, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north southwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Bright green trees and healthy bushes stand out sporadically on the dusty steppe. The little spring fed islands are surrounded by the blue-green grasses that thrive here. All manner of beasts are drawn to the springs and the protection they offer. Bright blue scrub jays chatter noisily among themselves as they dart and swerve in accomplished aerial feats pursuing their winged insect meals. A small herd of wary jackrabbits stop munching the grass to turn their white ears towards the merchant road. The nearest jack to the road stands on his hind legs and tests the air for any scent of their many predators.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast south*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Blending perfectly with the muted hues of the arid surroundings, a lone timber wolf stalks the outer edges of the grassland about a half a mile from the merchant road. The wolf's ears are perked to listen for the rustling of the bushy tailed jack rabbits that thrive in the prairie. The wolf lifts it nose to catch a scent, howls briefly and trots off towards the southeast to catch it's prey from downwind.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Game trails cut back and forth across the merchants road covered with the split, sharp toed hoof prints of deer and elk. Dark spoor mark the trails most frequently used by the herbivores: the hunted. Sharp yipping pierces the cold, quiet air from both sides of the road: the hunters. The widely spaced junipers, scrub oaks, and mountain hawthorns offer ample cover for the pack of wolves to range unseen through the plateau.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A brisk wind barrels down from the mountains to the north, its touch filled with the promise of ice and snow. As it passes the dry road-bed, it mixes with the warm moist air of the river valley that creeps north and causes dust dervishes that spin their opaque bodies thousands of feet into the air. The sharp bladed grasses shiver and swirl as the tiny twisters weave their way across the steppe.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road tops a low swell in the dusty green grass ocean of the dry steppe. From here, it is possible to observe an astounding 360 degree vista of the towering mountains to the north, the thick oak forest to the southeast, and more dry grasslands to the south and west. The terrain buckles and bends towards the north like a giant rug of trees and rocks had been pushed towards a wall of solid rock.

The merchant road takes a turn around a large, scraggy rock formation. To the northeast, the tall hills provide an ample wind break and here a small pine forest thrives. The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Tall, rough barked pine trees dominate the canyon floor as far as the eye can see. The vaulting slender trees compete for the sunlight high above the forest floor, leaving great visibility throughout the valley. At the south end of the hidden vale, the slow stream runs muddy as it snakes and loops around some of the older trees. Towards the north is an unnatural grouping of low lying mud domes.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Resembling mud hovels, haphazardly stacked balls of ochre mud surround the quiet, deep pool. The mud 'homes' are evenly spaced with great care and strange secretions surround the far sides.  Several large, flat stones half-submerged in the water cross the shallow end of the pool, each marked with the recent drippings and wet footprints of a large beast with long toes and sharp claws.

You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast southwest.
>
You follow Helios northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The north end of a hidden pine tree forest abutts a stone outcropping. This small box ended canyon shelters the verdant green trees and a small sluggish stream as if protecting them from the broken backbones of bedrock and undulating dirt and rocks strewn to the north.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st rogue and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north southwest*.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road follows the path of least resistance through the broken, rocky, higher foothills.  What is a well engineered road in the tamer steppe-lands becomes a minor miracle through the rougher hills and valleys. The road bed remains flat and easy to travel despite the rocky terrain. Each incline and decline in the road is fixed to an agreeable grade for most wagons and sleds. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: south* northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Following a ravine in the cliffs of the higher foothills, the merchant road by-passes a jagged rock formation that repeats in a row from north to south for miles.  Like the decaying backbone of a huge creature buried in soil, the shattered rocks points their broken ribs to the northeast.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Following a small ridge of a hill, the merchant road cuts through the west side, protecting it from the gusty winds that barrels down the mountain sides. The tall pine trees that have begun to populate the higher foothills lean away from the mountains due to the wind's continuous blowing.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The merchant road cuts straight through a hill where men and beasts must have toiled to remove tons of blasted rock and dirt. The choice to remove hundreds of feet of hillside was more prudent to the road engineers then a long series of switch-backs that would have to climb the steep hillside for hundreds of feet. Tube shaped holes drilled into the bedrock still remain from when the roadbed was blasted eons years ago.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

A solid brass smelted road marker was made to fit perfectly into a cylinder carved in a large boulder. The boulder is pure white crystal quartz, fractured and broken into beautiful prisms around the edges, but remains whole and pure in the center. The road marker clearly points out the cardinal directions using four arrows.   A solid brass road marker is here.

l
The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

Protected by an outcropping of the rocks that tops another high hill, an oasis of vibrant green mosses reveal a small spring that barely dampens the rocky soil. An industrious and thirsty traveler has coaxed the tricklet of water through a small trench that slowly fills a shallow stone basin. The granite basin holds only enough water to fill a few waterbags.

The area brightens.
[North Bridge Trail.]

The jagged mountains and snow capped peaks cannot be viewed along this portion of the merchant road, due to the proximity of the range.  Deep valleys and steep hillsides further hinder any vantage points other then straight ahead and behind.  For all intents and purposes, the mountains do not exist in this passage through the rippled land.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

The merchant road dips down into a small valley with steep walls, cutting across the incline like a switch-back to reduce the grade.  This long but narrow canyon is tree-less and full of gravel and broken rocks. As if to emphasize the strangeness of the sheered rocks, a line of split stone expands across the very center of the valley.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

The sandy soil of the steppe has been ripped away to reveal its intimate underpinnings.  The matted roots of the prairie grasses desperately hold into what little dirt they can while below in wide layers, the rocks and dirt tell the story of the plateau and the surrounding foothills. Each straition varies in texture, composition and color. They are an open book for those with the specific knowledge to read it.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

The merchant road threads through bottom of the small, narrow valley. Sheer granite walls block the view from the well traveled road to either side and above, only a narrow ray of sky testifies to the time of day. The engineers set a route as far as possible from the broken stones in the center of the valley and, by luck or design, this foresight has saved the road-bed from constant reconstruction. Small cracks run parallel to the road, but none have broken through the thick layers of sand and stone.

[Tarath Fault.]

Tumbled boulders and landslides fan down from the crumbling walls of the valley. In the more narrow spots, the alluvial fans of debris clog the roadway and the practical merchants and their caravans have had to devise small detours around the bigger obstacles.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

One layer of rock in the steep walls has eroded faster then the harder granite or bedrock above and below it. Soft sandstone has been stripped away to form an arch in the valley wall ... a concave indention that goes for hundreds of feet in both directions.  Within the hardened sediment left ages ago upon the land are treasures beyond value: fossilized shells by the thousands, in all sizes, shapes and colors.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Fault.]

The momentous forces that have wrought this valley still press upon the land and have done so for eons.  The walls of the valley are sheer and steep, and untouched by the raging waters of river or stream.  As if in testimony to the power of the forces that move the land, a huge dark boulder sits off to the side of the road. It is hewn in half like a sliced melon.  One part sits 20 feet north along the break in the rocks from the other part.

[Tarath Bends.]

Often referred to as "badlands", the sheered rocks, broken cliffs and ridged terrain would be impassable if not for the road. A narrow, steep walled canyon juts to the southeast, disappearing into the convoluted, rippled hills.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A short vibration shudders the roadbed, causing dust and gravel to shimmy down the canyon walls. A few larger rocks ping and ricochet off boulders, until all is deadly silent.  The merchant road is dusted with bits of broken rock, covering any recent tracks.

Arion smiles.
[Tarath Bends.]

A short vibration shudders the roadbed, causing dust and gravel to shimmy down the canyon walls. A few larger rocks ping and ricochet off boulders, until all is deadly silent.  The merchant road is dusted with bits of broken rock, covering any recent tracks. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st foreign merchant, the 2nd foreign merchant, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southwest northwest.
>
You follow Helios northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The rocky valley walls widen to the accommodate the splitting of the Tarath fault line. The Great Divide towers to the north beyond the fractured, broken badlands. Sheer, monolithic cliffs dropping for thousands of feet front the western edge of the mountains; their sharp, snow-capped peaks vaulting nearly vertically from the floor of the fault line valley. The merchant road bed is cracked and broken as it negotiates the larger twists and turns.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast* northwest.
[Tarath Bends.]

The rocky valley walls widen to the accommodate the splitting of the Tarath fault line. The Great Divide towers to the north beyond the fractured, broken badlands. Sheer, monolithic cliffs dropping for thousands of feet front the western edge of the mountains; their sharp, snow-capped peaks vaulting nearly vertically from the floor of the fault line valley. The merchant road bed is cracked and broken as it negotiates the larger twists and turns.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast northwest.
>
You follow Helios northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The trembling fault line reveals the cataclysmic trauma of the solid bedrock beneath the mountains. Striations of tortured, twisted rock bent almost in half under the strain stand out dramatically against darker, older layers of bedrock.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast* west.
[Tarath Bends.]

Obvious paths: southeast west.
>
You follow Helios west...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A short tremor suddenly rocks the cracked merchant road! A dusty pall sifts into the air from cracks in the ground and the shifting of gravel around the valley.  The tremor rolls through the canyon walls like a ripple, as if it were a linen sheet that was lifted and settled again. Pack animals and travelers alike stop momentarily and then hasten their pace as if to leave the quake behind them.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lizardman, the 2nd lizardman, the 3rd lizardman, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* west.
[Tarath Bends.]

Obvious paths: east west.
>
You follow Helios west...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

As the merchant road approaches the western end of the valley, the valley wall abruptly falls away to a sheer drop. Crumbling rock and dirt spill constantly into the deep abyss. Sections of the mountain have slid away into the valley and the merchant road has been rebuilt higher along the steeper sides of the mountain. The fault line of broken rocks continues its path of destruction to the west, skirted by the land-slide prone softer dirt.   A freshly uncovered crevice is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lizardman, the 2nd lizardman, the 3rd lizardman, the 1st carnivorous toad, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* northwest.

You follow Helios northwest...


A carnivorous toad enters, following Helios's group.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A treacherous dusty trail leads west along the shaky fault line from a fork in the main road. The original roadbed has fallen into the chasm years ago, leaving the merchants to their own wiles to ply the slippery slopes past the fault zone. Many attempts have failed at conquering the shifting dirt and rocks. Currently a bumpy trail skirts the bigger rocks and loose gravel. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st ogre, the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar), and the 1st carnivorous toad.
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast* west northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The narrow roadbed slopes precariously towards the long drop to the jagged rocks.  Loose gravel and dirt coat the slippery trail and sift constantly into the deep abyss making the air down in the deep valley seem thick. No breeze stirs from the drop-off and the valley is choked with haze. 

This area is illuminated.

You follow Helios west...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Cutting across a wide debris path, the merchant road is barely discernible from the hemorrhage of slowly decaying mountain.  Small footprints track across the torpid river but disappear within hours. To the north, a landmark of sorts allows travelers a point from which to reconoiter their path. A mount of rocks that resembles the beak of a large bird marks the northern rim of the crater. Southbound traffic must rely on their wits to reach the badlands beyond the chasm. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* northwest.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A tenacious layer of solid rock shoots across the shifting dirt like a line of markers. The merchant road dutifully travels the steeper slope so that wagon wheels, shod hooves and boots can take advantage of the additional purchase on the slippery canyon rim. Through the hazy dust down inside the chasm walls, broken wagons, large animal skeletons and various smashed boxes and barrels grimly display the dangerous conditions of the trail. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Gaining some altitude above the dangerous chasm walls, the merchant road follows the natural contour of the valley walls. A distant thundering fills the still air.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The straight line of nubby, hard bedrock fortifies a cliff that dangles thousands of feet above the shifting gravel of the chasm.  Across the dusty valley, magnificent granite cliffs shoulder a pass through the snow topped mountains. The merchant road follows the perilous cliff, with precious little room more than the width of a wagon pulled by a team of oxen.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The trecherous path holds steady through the loose rock and gravel, following the old dead backbone of rocks that travel from east to west.  Exposed tree roots demonstrate the speed of the valleys erosion. Two huge pine trees lean to the north, stalwart in their last attempts to hang onto the mountainside with just half of their roots.   A tall ancient pine tree and a towering ancient pine tree are here.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Wide, deep stairs mark a change in elevation for the merchant road. Chopped by sheer brute strength from the crumbling mountainside, the slippery granite steps pose a difficult traverse for wheeled transports of all kinds. Although they are shallow, the steps jar spokes and strain axles as the wagons are slowly dropped down or levered up the incline.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Slippery, decomposing granite covers the narrow roadbed causing heavy objects like loaded wagons to skitter sideways from the weight.  Steel pegs and pitons have been pounded into the boulders overhead for added security and the experienced drivers run safety lines from team to wagon, and on down the line.   A rusty anchored steel cable is here.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Caused by constant traffic, ice and earthquakes, grooves and cracks resembling those on a washboard cut across the crumbling granite bed of the merchant road. Wheeled transports shudder along the chopped surface, shaking any carelessly packed items to smithereens.  Even the most faithless of merchants mutter prayers to unknown deities as they pass along this narrow shelf of rock.  A rusty anchored steel cable is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st carnivorous toad and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

Obvious paths: east west*.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The merchant road is unrecognizable on this trek across the vast, disintegrating cliff face of the Tarath Bends. Below, the original excellent engineering and construction has preserved the roadbed for hundreds of years. Passing the craggy cliffs has undone even this masterful work, demonstrating how the power of nature rules Aradath.     A rusty anchored steel cable is here.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The narrow shelf of crumbling mountainside constantly sheds its foundations down the chasm wall. The granite is so rutted in some places that several large wide planks have been placed at wagon wheel width to aid their passage without slipping into the abyss to the south.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Several old split planks placed end to end are propped between the rock shelf and the lower, to the southwest. Four shaggy mules balk at stepping on the cracking planks as the weight of an over-loaded canvas covered wagon bows the boards to the breaking point. The sweating drover is standing on his brakes, his hands clenched in white knuckled fists on the eight reins. Several caravan guards grab the halters of the mules and attempt to haul them forward.    Some greying oak planks are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Two magnificent lodestones lay cradled by a thin stretch of solid bedrock within the crumbling granite cliff.  Each square block of solid granite is perfectly chiseled, shaped and placed to bear the load of a suspension bridge that crosses a narrow, but deep crack in the cliff.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The rocky shoulders to your sides create a light shadow that has become the home of many insects, shielding them from the sun when it is out. Now and then a line of ants will cross over the path.

[Tarath Bends.]

The rocky shoulders to your sides create a light shadow that has become the home of many insects, shielding them from the sun when it is out. Now and then a line of ants will cross over the path.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east west.
>
You follow Helios east...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path twists to the northeast and west here, much as it has done countless times before on your journey. The sharp, jagged rocks threaten to slice travelers who are careless in choosing their footing.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lizardman, the 2nd lizardman, the 3rd lizardman, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast west*.
[Tarath Bends.]

The path twists to the northeast and west here, much as it has done countless times before on your journey. The sharp, jagged rocks threaten to slice travelers who are careless in choosing their footing.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st lizardman, the 2nd lizardman, the 3rd lizardman, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast west.
>
You follow Helios northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Staggered steps lead downhill to the west from a concave summit of crumbling granite. The merchant road tops the slightly domed rock cap that is miles wide, and is marked only by stacks of flat topped rocks. To the southwest is a frightening drop-off of sheer mountain cliffs that dashes into a valley floor obscured by dust. 

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east southwest*.
[Tarath Bends.]
