l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Along the path of the merchant road are markers of stacked rocks to indicate the correct way over the flat, granite dome. For miles, gray to white polished granite dominates the rock-topped landscape with one exception. A few paces off the roadway, the hard rock dips into a small ditch that is strewn with broken rocks and marked by dark recesses. The wind whips several gossamer filaments of light stringy material out of the darker region of the ditch.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east west*.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

You pick your way over rocks and bushes as you walk along a rugged path. Far below you in the valley, you can see the remains of the road that runs toward Spur. The track continues to twist and turn east and west from here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st wolverine, the 2nd wolverine, and the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east* west.
[Tarath Bends.]

Obvious paths: east west.
>
You follow Helios west...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

This is a rather level part of the track that winds its way around the mountain. The track is covered with large rocks and stones, and the west wall of the mountain looks like it has crumbled away. The track drops off sharply to the south.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

What once was the intersection of two roads is now a single road paralleled by a massive amount of rock, mud and timber. A new landslide covers the older settled debris making passage to the northeast impossible. Rocks and pebbles lay across the path making movement precarious. The new landslide still groans and shifts ever so slightly.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st eagle (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Helios the Draco (an eagle upon his left shoulder), Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast* southwest.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

You walk along the rocky slope of the Tarath Bends and the elevation is getting quite high.  The air is cool here, and you glance northward at the knife-edged peaks that stretch impossibly in the distance, much higher than here.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

You're trudging along a level, man-made road that cuts along the Tarath Bends.  To the east, the road fragments into a rocky landslide that obviously occured long ago.  The road continues to the west.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The mountain side has broken away and has fallen across the southern road. Sharp boulders poke through mounds of smaller rocks and mud, blocking the old roadway. Nature has a way of changing what man does, as is apparent by the natural roadway crossing through the rubble to the northwest.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Piles of rubble flank the road on both sides. Some new and some old, this rubble is a mixture of two guard towers and this side of the mountain. High above, the jagged peak of the small mountain thrusts itself out over the road, ready to collapse under the right circumstances. A new rent has been cut into the southeastern side of the mountain, allowing passage to the southern road.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Tarath Bends.]

The roadway hugs the edge of the meadow underneath the sheer stone wall of this deep valley. The dry grasses growing in the meadow move back and forth with the swift valley gusts.

The slope is covered with loose stones and boulders. Just to the north the gently sloping hills end, and steep cliffs rise sharply up towards the mountain peaks.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast west*.
[Tarath Bends.]

The slope is covered with loose stones and boulders. Just to the north the gently sloping hills end, and steep cliffs rise sharply up towards the mountain peaks.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast west.
>
You follow Helios northeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Old trees lay side by side with the massive boulders of the mountain, intermingling in a terrible landslide. The mountain top has broken off and slid across the eastern road stopping all forms of transportation. It would take years for mortal hands to remove the tons of stone from the original roadway to make it passable once again. Thankfully, nature has changed the landscape for the better, and has opened a gap through the mountain to the north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north southwest*.

You follow Helios north...


l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A massive rent opens up between the mountain side heading south. Boulders sit precariously on the mountain side ready to fall to the ground. Many tons of earth have shifted from the face of the mountain to the ground, covering the small growth of forest at its base. The southeastern road is totally blocked with rubble.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast south* west.

[Tarath Bends.]

The slope of the land begins to steepen as you make your way up the incline.  Beneath your feet the trail is slowly becoming more rock than dirt.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Grooves cut by water running down from the mountain show evidence of a recent heavy rain.  The path is partially blocked by the rocks and earth that have eroded from above.

[Tarath Bends.]

The trail continues around a large pile of stones showing evidence of a landslide.  Beyond the rocks the trees can no longer be seen.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

As you round the last bend your breath is taken away by the sheer length, width, and depth of the gorge that lies ahead. The area is scarred as if from mining, you notice small pieces of silver scattered about the area.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

As you continue you notice that the granite in this area has been deeply mined. Large granite boulders have been literally yanked from this gorge to reveal the ore that sat for centuries deep inside the earth.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

Large pieces of shale and slate tower over you looking as if they will fall at any moment. Those that mined this area must not have cared much for safety. As you listen you hear soft rumbling as if the gorge could collapse at any time.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Gorge.]

Steep cragged walls tower above you. Large rocks of all types sit precariously on the edge of the gorge. As you walk small pebbles rain down on you, dislodged by the sound of your footsteps.

[Tarath Gorge.]

The footing here seems a bit unstable. As you continue on your journey, you wonder what this land was like before the mining began. Something seems to glint in the sunlight on the northern horizon.  A large pile of rocks is here.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A wide rocky trail heads off into the mountainous terrain in an easterly direction. A large pile of rocks from an old landslide partially blocks passage in the other direction. Cracks and crevasses mar trail's surface, as runoff from the mountain snow makes its way to lower ground. Lush green bushes, and small trees dot the landscape, mingling with large boulders and smaller rocks.  A large pile of rocks is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A strong breeze blows off the mountains of the Great Divide. It both slows your climb and encourages your decent into the valley. The brush and trees lean noticeably towards the east, as if it was easier for them to just grow in the direction of the wind then to try and fight their natural instinct of reaching to the sun.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A large rotted tree lies directly in your path. The trail swerves around the stump, forcing all carts and travelers to fit between a large rock and the upraised roots. Scrapes and scratches on the rock leads one to believe that not every cart has fit through here comfortably.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The trail winds around the large fallen tree. Smaller saplings, and fungus grows in the soil that is being enriched by the decaying tree. Several rocks dot the newly carved trail around the tree, making travel difficult. It is fairly certain many have cursed the falling of this great tree, and subsequent detour.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A small birds nest has been built within one of the larger cracks of the great tree. Twittering, chirping and the occasional rustling is quite noticeable from the nest as the babies all vie for whatever sustenance their parent brings. A quick flash red and mother bird flies off to find more worms.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A makeshift path has been created to circumvent the large tree that has fallen down and blocked the regular path. Lying on its side, the log stands two heads higher then the tallest Thugian. Its leafy top continues to grow, as if the fact that the roots are no longer bound to the ground makes no difference at all.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

A carpet of needles covers the path. Pine cones, larger then a Thugian fist, dot the ground. Enormous trees collide with large boulders blocking you from venturing too deep into the overgrown wood. The squawk of a large bird echoes from far overhead, but looking up to identify it would be futile, as it perches in branches hundreds of feet above your head.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Only the hardiest of life forms hold their own on the rocky steppes. Small cascades of icy water stream down the boulders and darken their surfaces. Tough lichen and scrub pines absorb nutrients from the mineral laden run-off. The sun shines brightly on the southern exposure of the trail, sheltered from the wind and freezing cold. Bright green oases of life sprout from rocky niches and the path is slippery where the green slimy growths cross it.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast west*.

l
The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

Thin ribbons of different colored gravel and debris fan out in the valley far below, terminating in great piles. Dark hues of maroon, purple and gray striate the great runs of rock, mingling with occasional drifts of glowing snow and tangles of dead trees.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east northwest*.
[Tarath Bends.]

Thin ribbons of different colored gravel and debris fan out in the valley far below, terminating in great piles. Dark hues of maroon, purple and gray striate the great runs of rock, mingling with occasional drifts of glowing snow and tangles of dead trees.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east northwest.

You follow Helios east...

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The pitch of the path is precarious for carts and wheeled vehicles. The splintered wood from unfortunate wheels and spokes gathers in the cracks and crags by the side of the path. Brightly colored bits of metal and smashed pieces of iron plating stand out in contrast against the sparkling granite.

The area brightens.
[Tarath Bends.]

The stark terrain is impressive in its scope and austerity. One cannot help but feel insignificant and temporary amid the expanse of granite and limestone formed through the millennia. Washed by rain, scorched by the sun and frozen by storms, the rocks endure, a testament to the strength of the Great Divide.

[Tarath Bends.]

The path leads downward is sheltered from the howling wind, rain and relentless sun by steep walls of granite. Animal tracks are barely visible in what little dust lies on the rough surface of the rock. A quiet calm descends momentarily on the sheltered walkway.

l
The area brightens.
[Traveler's Camp.]

Huge boulders have created a bowl shaped depression in this sheltered hillock. A stand of scruffy trees continues to eke out a tenuous existence above the rocky outpost; their long tortured roots clinging desperately to what little soil is caught between the boulders. Prevailing winds from the mountaintop have caused the trunks to lean westward, the upper branches creating a canopy over the area.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

l
The area brightens.
[Traveler's Camp.]

Beneath the trees, many a caravan has stopped to water their draft animals and rest for the night. The area is strewn with animal refuse, bits of feed, and the resulting lingering aroma. The discarded feed and rubbish left by the travelers is picked over constantly by the hillock's inhabitants. In such a harsh environment, very little waste is left by the local scavengers.

This area is illuminated.

l
The area brightens.
[Traveler's Camp.]

A small spring fed stream meanders around the bowl, filling a pool on the western side of the path. A series of miniature waterfalls gurgle delightfully along the edges of the camp. The resulting pool is quite deep and crystal clear, even with the constant watering of pack animals. The flow of the spring must be constantly replenishing the pool, for no algae or slime clouds its depths.  A small crystal clear pool is here.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Traveler's Camp.]

The boulders bear scars from deeply driven pinions and screws used to hold cables and reins, or perhaps impromptu corrals for the portage animals. The paths that enter and exit the haven are narrow and strewn with small but heavy rocks. Any wagons drawn this far would have to be manhandled over them using cables, levers, or wedges.

The area brightens.
[Traveler's Camp.]

A lean-to built from odds and ends serves as a way station for exhausted travelers. Gathered firewood lines the lean-to's walls, and a small darkened pit smolders outside the opening. Inside the small, cramped lean-to, light filters in through the makeshift construction. The possibility of being snowed in and sheltering for a long period in this little hovel is not a welcome proposition.

[Ari'kian Trail.]

The dark granite walls of the tunnel are so well engineered that no cracks have appeared, even after years of pressure from the mountain. The lack of telltale dust or sand fouling the perfect floor does little to take one's mind off the looming presence of millions of tons of rock above.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

While the tunnel is still well made and structurally sound, the air deep within is dank and moist. On closer inspection, hair-line fractures have appeared in the smoothly cut tunnel walls, allowing a few moist rivuletes to seep through onto the granite's surface. The walls are streaked dark from the constant flow of the cold, clear water.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

Old rusted sconces stand sentry along both sides of this end of the giant tunnel. While time has marred the surface of the tunnel walls with minute cracks, the absolute precision and remarkable smoothness of the carved rock are still very impressive. Fresh, cool air blows in from outside.  An exit is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: west*.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

Old rusted sconces stand sentry along both sides of this end of the giant tunnel. While time has marred the surface of the tunnel walls with minute cracks, the absolute precision and remarkable smoothness of the carved rock are still very impressive. Fresh, cool air blows in from outside.  An exit is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you and holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

A lavish garden stretches between a rocky cliff to the west and a dark keep to the east. The flowers and shrubbery are immaculate, but the landscape is strangely quiet and completely devoid of movement. The lively, vibrant colors of the blossoms contrast with the deathly stillness. A large tunnel descends into the depths of the cliff-face.

This area is illuminated.

[Ari'kian Keep Grounds.]

Stepping stones cut across what was once a large lawn. Their destination is the rather imposing manse to the north. Weeds have choked out any grass that may have at one time existed. [Ari'kian Keep.]

Entering the foyer the first thing you notice is its subtle opulence. The floor is highly polished black marble, the walls are covered with a gold stripped, cream colored paper. Light filters in through a large paned glass window which, at one time must have glistened, but is now coated with the accumulation of years of dirt. A finely crafted staircase, its balustrade polished from many years of use, rises to the second floor unsupported.  A polished oak circular staircase and some open massive black obsidian double doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: east northwest.

The area brightens.
[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

A large dining room table stands in the middle of the room covered by large dust throws. Intricately carved wooden legs peek out from beneath the blankets. A large chandelier, filled with the remnants of burned out candles, hangs above the table. On the floor a once beautiful black and red rug lies worn and faded, covered with a light coating of dust.

This area is illuminated.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Two sideboards stand against the far wall, cold and unused. When the keep was occupied the servants could carry in a sumptuous meal and have it ready to be served at a moments notice. [Servants' Entrance, Ari'kian Keep.]

Allowing the servants access from the kitchen and servants' quarters to all areas of the keep, this entrance has been carefully placed in the rear of the residence. Those who bring the food from the unattached kitchen, and those who maintain the keep, have access to the not only the first floor, but the basement and the upper sleeping quarters.  A stone staircase, an oak staircase, and an open wooden door are here.

In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north south.
[Path, Ari'kian Keep.]

The kitchen path takes you past a beautiful garden to your east and a family cemetery to your west. The surrounding hedge leaves you little room to head down a small path and into the garden. An old rusted gate blocks your entrance to the cemetery.  An open rusted black gate and a small overgrown path are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north south.
>
You follow Helios north...

The area brightens.
[Path, Ari'kian Keep.]

You stand outside a short and squat building. No less then four chimneys rise from its flat roof. Several small windows run across the front of the building each with soot stains rising above them. In all probability they were used to allow heat to escape during the warm summer months.  An open smoke stained door is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian (flying beside you), Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. [Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. [Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, a large faded headstone, some gold coins, and a closed emblazoned black leather lockpick case are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north northeast east*.

He appears to be in perfect health.

He appears to be in perfect health.

He appears to be in perfect health.

The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. The calm is broken by the screeching of a raven overhead that sends chills up your spine.  An open rusted black gate is here.

This area is illuminated.

Obvious paths: north west northwest.

The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, a large faded headstone, and a closed emblazoned black leather lockpick case are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. The calm is broken by the screeching of a raven overhead that sends chills up your spine.  An open rusted black gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* west northwest.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. l
The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, a large faded headstone, a smooth white sharpening stone, a smooth white sharpening stone, and a pair of warm fuzzy mittens are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (flying beside you and holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north northeast east*.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. [Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A large group of small cherubs stand sentinel in the grass. Arranged in random pattern, they face both towards you and towards the beautiful view to the north and west. Each is a replica of the other, and all are labeled with the same single word, "Baby."

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

A covered path leads between the main house and the kitchen. Rough stones have been worn smooth from years of use. On either side of the path a tall hedge blocks any inclimate weather.  An open wooden door is here.

[Path, Ari'kian Keep.]

The kitchen path takes you past a beautiful garden to your east and a family cemetery to your west. The surrounding hedge leaves you little room to head down a small path and into the garden. The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. The calm is broken by the screeching of a raven overhead that sends chills up your spine.  An open rusted black gate is here.

This area is illuminated.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A large group of small cherubs stand sentinel in the grass. Arranged in random pattern, they face both towards you and towards the beautiful view to the north and west. Each is a replica of the other, and all are labeled with the same single word, "Baby."

The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north northeast* east.

[Path, Ari'kian Keep.]

You stand outside a short and squat building. No less then four chimneys rise from its flat roof. Several small windows run across the front of the building each with soot stains rising above them. A mysterious green glow suddenly surrounds the 2nd lost wandering soul's head!  

The 2nd lost wandering soul suddenly slows down a bit!

Timid begins chanting softly to the heavens.

The lost wandering soul smiles wickedly after the attempt to turn it!

The kitchen path takes you past a beautiful garden to your east and a family cemetery to your west. The surrounding hedge leaves you little room to head down a small path and into the garden. [Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: south.
>

The area brightens.
[Path, Ari'kian Keep.]

The kitchen path takes you past a beautiful garden to your east and a family cemetery to your west. The surrounding hedge leaves you little room to head down a small path and into the garden. [Servants' Entrance, Ari'kian Keep.]

Allowing the servants access from the kitchen and servants' quarters to all areas of the keep, this entrance has been carefully placed in the rear of the residence. Those who bring the food from the unattached kitchen, and those who maintain the keep, have access to the not only the first floor, but the basement and the upper sleeping quarters.  A stone staircase, an oak staircase, and an open wooden door are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st lost wandering soul.
In the room are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: southeast west*.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A large marble statue stands in the weed filled grass. Two battle-ready San Elves hold up a very large black sword towards the sky. Each of the four sides of the base has an intricate carving that depicts a battle of epic proportions.  A marble statue, a gold coin, some silver coins, an old leather saddle, and a short black talon are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: south southwest west.

The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. A large marble statue stands in the weed filled grass. Two battle-ready San Elves hold up a very large black sword towards the sky. Each of the four sides of the base has an intricate carving that depicts a battle of epic proportions.  A marble statue, an old leather saddle, a large hammered copper shield, a closed white speckled leather cookbook, and an open muddy leopardskin bag are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Helios the Draco, Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: south southwest west.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. The calm is broken by the screeching of a raven overhead that sends chills up your spine.  An open rusted black gate is here.

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Path, Ari'kian Keep.]

You stand outside a short and squat building. No less then four chimneys rise from its flat roof. Several small windows run across the front of the building each with soot stains rising above them. In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* south.
[Path, Ari'kian Keep.]

The kitchen path takes you past a beautiful garden to your east and a family cemetery to your west. The surrounding hedge leaves you little room to head down a small path and into the garden. An old rusted gate blocks your entrance to the cemetery.  An open rusted black gate and a small overgrown path are here.

The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. The calm is broken by the screeching of a raven overhead that sends chills up your spine.  An open rusted black gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

The area brightens.
[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A large group of small cherubs stand sentinel in the grass. Arranged in random pattern, they face both towards you and towards the beautiful view to the north and west. Each is a replica of the other, and all are labeled with the same single word, "Baby."

[Servants' Entrance, Ari'kian Keep.]

Allowing the servants access from the kitchen and servants' quarters to all areas of the keep, this entrance has been carefully placed in the rear of the residence. Those who bring the food from the unattached kitchen, and those who maintain the keep, have access to the not only the first floor, but the basement and the upper sleeping quarters.  A stone staircase, an oak staircase, and an open wooden door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: southeast west*.

The area brightens.
[Parlor, Ari'kian Keep.]

A cream colored settee, embroidered with small black and gold roses, leans against the wall. A small, low slung table resides several feet in front of it. On the table a piece of fine porcelain has been smashed into small non-distinguishable pieces. Scattered on the floor is the rest of a very beautiful porcelain tea set, in various states of destruction.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Two sideboards stand against the far wall, cold and unused. When the keep was occupied the servants could carry in a sumptuous meal and have it ready to be served at a moments notice. Each sideboard is stained with many different sauces, and several burn marks from past meals.  A pair of stained oak sideboards are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Dirt streaked windows look out upon what was once a beautiful lawn. The morning sun shines into them, brightening the dining room each and every morning. Below the window is a small bench covered with cushions that are starting to rot with age. A small child's toy lies on its side, wedged between two cushions, long forgotten by its owner.  A small red and white child's toy is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Eight high-back dining room chairs stand in disarray against a cream and gold papered wall. Their black linen seats are embroidered with the same color design as can be seen in the wall paper. Dust covers the intricate wood designs of their backs, and dims the once beautiful colors of their seats. Why they sit here, instead of being carefully covered as the table, remains a mystery.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

    The scowling servant ghost is knocked back!

The flames about the scowling servant ghost's body quickly die out.

A mysterious green glow suddenly surrounds the scowling servant ghost's head!  

The green glow about the scowling servant ghost's head dims and fades away.

The scowling servant ghost suddenly slows down a bit.

The scowling servant ghost grabs at Lewelin!
The attack is a well-delivered blow to the head.

He has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.

  You examine Lewelin the Usil Elf...

The howling child spirit's speed returns to normal.

[Path, Ari'kian Keep.]

The kitchen path takes you past a beautiful garden to your east and a family cemetery to your west. The surrounding hedge leaves you little room to head down a small path and into the garden. An old rusted gate blocks your entrance to the cemetery.  An open rusted black gate and a small overgrown path are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. [Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. [Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north northeast east*.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

Several larger head stones are set up in a circular pattern in the weed infested grass. Their sizes vary and are all intricately carved. Over half of them have overgrown flowering bushes in front of them. At one time the flowers were a beautiful sign of dedication, now they just blot out the worn wording on the stones.  A worn pink headstone, a crumbling white headstone, and a large faded headstone are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st howling child spirit and the 1st screaming tortured banshee.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north northeast east*.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. The calm is broken by the screeching of a raven overhead that sends chills up your spine.  An open rusted black gate is here.

[Cemetary, Ari'kian Keep.]

A once beautiful garden, now overgrown with weeds, frames the entrance to this small cemetery. A large tree casts shade across the area. It is as if it was planted just for that reason. The calm is broken by the screeching of a raven overhead that sends chills up your spine.  An open rusted black gate is here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st howling child spirit, the 2nd howling child spirit, and the 3rd howling child spirit.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north west northwest.

Allowing the servants access from the kitchen and servants' quarters to all areas of the keep, this entrance has been carefully placed in the rear of the residence. Those who bring the food from the unattached kitchen, and those who maintain the keep, have access to the not only the first floor, but the basement and the upper sleeping quarters. [Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

A finely crafted breakfront dominates this corner of the dining room. A sprinkling of glass litters its top, having fallen from one of the open doors above. Pieces of chipped porcelain line the shelves, all the finer pieces having disappeared or been broken. One drawer lies on the floor broken into small pieces and charred, as if someone thought to use it to start a small fire.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Eight high-back dining room chairs stand in disarray against a cream and gold papered wall. Their black linen seats are embroidered with the same color design as can be seen in the wall paper. Dust covers the intricate wood designs of their backs, and dims the once beautiful colors of their seats. Why they sit here, instead of being carefully covered as the table, remains a mystery.

[Second Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

Set in the eastern wall is a polished oak door. Its diminutive size gives the impression that it was only used by servants. A large closet stands very close to the door. A quick peek through the slightly ajar door reveals a vast array of yellowing linens. A small old table leans precariously against the western wall of the hallway. Its size is just perfect to hold a variety of items the master and mistress might need brought upstairs by their servants.  An open polished oak door and an oak staircase are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Timid the Secian, Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Basement, Ari'kian Keep.]

Cold stone steps continue downward into the bowels of the keep. The walls are covered with a green fungus that is very slippery. The door at the bottom of this staircase warped from moisture, and water covers the bottom four steps of the stairway. One had better be a decent swimmer if he is going to explore down here.  An open moldy door and a stone staircase are here.

[Servants' Entrance, Ari'kian Keep.]

Allowing the servants access from the kitchen and servants' quarters to all areas of the keep, this entrance has been carefully placed in the rear of the residence. Those who bring the food from the unattached kitchen, and those who maintain the keep, have access to the not only the first floor, but the basement and the upper sleeping quarters. [Study, Ari'kian Keep.]

As your eyes adjust to the natural darkness of the room, its rich opulence becomes apparent. Deep red carpet and matching draperies are offset by warm oak walls. Two brown velvet chairs sit against the western wall, an oak chest against the northern wall. The musky smell of books and dust weighs heavily in the air.  An open thick oak door is here.

This room is illuminated.

[Ari'kian Keep.]

Entering the foyer the first thing you notice is its subtle opulence. The floor is highly polished black marble, the walls are covered with a gold stripped, cream colored paper. Light filters in through a large paned glass window which, at one time must have glistened, but is now coated with the accumulation of years of dirt. A finely crafted staircase, its balustrade polished from many years of use, rises to the second floor unsupported.  A polished oak circular staircase and some open massive black obsidian double doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Servants' Entrance, Ari'kian Keep.]

Allowing the servants access from the kitchen and servants' quarters to all areas of the keep, this entrance has been carefully placed in the rear of the residence. Those who bring the food from the unattached kitchen, and those who maintain the keep, have access to the not only the first floor, but the basement and the upper sleeping quarters.  A stone staircase, an oak staircase, and an open wooden door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: southeast* west*.

You follow Clive west...

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Two sideboards stand against the far wall, cold and unused. When the keep was occupied the servants could carry in a sumptuous meal and have it ready to be served at a moments notice. Each sideboard is stained with many different sauces, and several burn marks from past meals.  A pair of stained oak sideboards are here.

This room is illuminated.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Dirt streaked windows look out upon what was once a beautiful lawn. The morning sun shines into them, brightening the dining room each and every morning. Below the window is a small bench covered with cushions that are starting to rot with age. A small child's toy lies on its side, wedged between two cushions, long forgotten by its owner.  A small red and white child's toy is here.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

A large dining room table stands in the middle of the room covered by large dust throws. Intricately carved wooden legs peek out from beneath the blankets. A large chandelier, filled with the remnants of burned out candles, hangs above the table. On the floor a once beautiful black and red rug lies worn and faded, covered with a light coating of dust.

This area is illuminated.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

A finely crafted breakfront dominates this corner of the dining room. A sprinkling of glass litters its top, having fallen from one of the open doors above. Pieces of chipped porcelain line the shelves, all the finer pieces having disappeared or been broken. One drawer lies on the floor broken into small pieces and charred, as if someone thought to use it to start a small fire.  Some slightly burnt cotton pot holders and a light slick hard snakeskin vest are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Dirt streaked windows look out upon what was once a beautiful lawn. The morning sun shines into them, brightening the dining room each and every morning. Below the window is a small bench covered with cushions that are starting to rot with age. A small child's toy lies on its side, wedged between two cushions, long forgotten by its owner.  A small red and white child's toy is here.

This room is illuminated.

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Two sideboards stand against the far wall, cold and unused. When the keep was occupied the servants could carry in a sumptuous meal and have it ready to be served at a moments notice. Each sideboard is stained with many different sauces, and several burn marks from past meals.  A pair of stained oak sideboards are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Servants' Entrance, Ari'kian Keep.]

Allowing the servants access from the kitchen and servants' quarters to all areas of the keep, this entrance has been carefully placed in the rear of the residence. Those who bring the food from the unattached kitchen, and those who maintain the keep, have access to the not only the first floor, but the basement and the upper sleeping quarters.  A stone staircase, an oak staircase, and an open wooden door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: southeast west*.

[Kitchen, Ari'kian Keep.]

Now cold and dusty, this room was once the hub of a very busy kitchen. Tables fill the room, each holding a various instrument needed to serve a large meal. Trenchers wait at the ready on one table, utensils lie unused upon another table, and covered trays sit gathering dust upon yet another table.  An open smoke stained door is here.

This room is illuminated.

[Basement, Ari'kian Keep.]

Cold stone steps continue downward into the bowels of the keep. The walls are covered with a green fungus that is very slippery. The door at the bottom of this staircase warped from moisture, and water covers the bottom four steps of the stairway. One had better be a decent swimmer if he is going to explore down here.  An open moldy door and a stone staircase are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: None.

[Servants' Entrance, Ari'kian Keep.]

Allowing the servants access from the kitchen and servants' quarters to all areas of the keep, this entrance has been carefully placed in the rear of the residence. Those who bring the food from the unattached kitchen, and those who maintain the keep, have access to the not only the first floor, but the basement and the upper sleeping quarters.  A stone staircase, an oak staircase, and an open wooden door are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: southeast west*.

The area brightens.
[Second Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

Set in the eastern wall is a polished oak door. Its diminutive size gives the impression that it was only used by servants. A large closet stands very close to the door. A quick peek through the slightly ajar door reveals a vast array of yellowing linens. A small old table leans precariously against the western wall of the hallway. Its size is just perfect to hold a variety of items the master and mistress might need brought upstairs by their servants.  An open polished oak door and an oak staircase are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: south.

[Second Floor, Ari'kian Keep.]

A broken frame holds a once beautiful door by only the bottom hinge. Panels on the door have been destroyed, the remnants litter the ground around your feet. [Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Two sideboards stand against the far wall, cold and unused. When the keep was occupied the servants could carry in a sumptuous meal and have it ready to be served at a moments notice. Each sideboard is stained with many different sauces, and several burn marks from past meals.  A pair of stained oak sideboards are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

You follow Clive southwest...

[Dining Room, Ari'kian Keep.]

Dirt streaked windows look out upon what was once a beautiful lawn. The morning sun shines into them, brightening the dining room each and every morning. Below the window is a small bench covered with cushions that are starting to rot with age. A small child's toy lies on its side, wedged between two cushions, long forgotten by its owner.  A small red and white child's toy is here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: northeast* east southeast*.

[Ari'kian Keep.]

Entering the foyer the first thing you notice is its subtle opulence. The floor is highly polished black marble, the walls are covered with a gold stripped, cream colored paper. Light filters in through a large paned glass window which, at one time must have glistened, but is now coated with the accumulation of years of dirt. A finely crafted staircase, its balustrade polished from many years of use, rises to the second floor unsupported.  A polished oak circular staircase and some open massive black obsidian double doors are here.

This room is illuminated.
In the room are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious exits: east northwest*.

[Ari'kian Trail.]

The path parts to accommodate an immense, ornate sundial, its base consisting of a gnarled tree trunk that has sprouted from the ground. Oddly, the face of the dial contains no numbers for telling time, and the usual protruberance that would mark the hours is a razor-sharp blade. It matters not; no shadow falls across the face to reveal the hour.

[Ari'kian Trail.]

A small, oval pool is nestled in the curve of the path. Lined entirely with perfectly round, charcoal-colored river rock, its crystalline water shines black, providing a perfect reflecting surface for the objects nearby. The water is so dark that it is difficult to gauge its depth. The surface is dead calm.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast west.
>
You follow Clive southeast...


l
The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

A large, metal arbor completely engulfed in black, thorny brambles sits to one side, sheltering a stone bust of some sort. The bust sits on a pedestal of most unusual design; it is a hodgepodge of metal weapons melted together and formed into a gleaming cube.  A massive carved obsidian bust is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: east northwest*.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

A pair of beautiful clematis climb up a pair of supports flanking the path, their exotic crimson blooms facing skyward. Their beauty seems incongruous with the supports they climb up, which happen to be sturdy posts fitted wih thick, cast iron rings. They seem like something prisoners would be chained to.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

Strange, otherworldly plants dot the landscape here and there. Several of them resemble Venus flytraps, except for one thing: They are large enough to devour something much larger than insects. Their hairy jaws gape open hungrily; what could they possibly feed upon? Perhaps it's better not to know.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

The meandering path wanders close to the boundary of the strange garden, revealing a wall-like hedge. It is too tall to see over the top, and closer examination reveals that it is comprised of particularly cruel brambles, with thorns as long as daggers. Are they to keep trespassers out, or in?

This area is illuminated.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kain Trail.]

A large, monolithic object stands a short distance from the path. It's so completely obscured by creeping ivy that it's difficult to tell just what it is. Somehow, leaving the path to risk putting a footprint in the landscape is unthinkable. It could be a statue... It could be almost anything in this bizarre place.  A vine-covered stone monolith is here.

The winds buffet you incessantly as you struggle along, driving particles of dust into your eyes and throwing you off balance at every turn. A strong wind is bad enough; one that capriciously changes directions is much, much worse.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southeast west*.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

The blowing grit swirls angrily around you with every errant breeze. It seems to sand the skin and infiltrate every crease of clothing, making travel fairly unpleasant. There is no good way to avoid the cloud that envelopes you.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: south northwest*.

The area brightens.
[Ari'kian Trail.]

Large chunks of dull, grey stone have been removed in the spots where the path requires it. At this point the side of the path is flanked by a ledge that makes a nice spot to sit and catch one's breath. Evidence of others who've had the same idea can be seen.  An open small tattered linen lunch sack is here.

[Ari'kian Trail.]

The land along the path is wild and largely unexplored. The terrain is rough and unforgiving, rife with steep rock faces and catapulting ravines. Anyone venturing here does so at their own risk.

l
The area brightens.
[Highland Plateau]

Many knobby hills border the western edge of the otherwise flat plateau, providing welcomed relief from the stinging winds. Tall brownish grass covers most of the hills, along with a few stunted thorny bushes. The grasslands extend vast distances to the east. A well worn trail leaves the plateau to the west between two tall hills.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast east west*.

A wide stone ledge extending out of the mountain side holds the ancient road. To the north the ledge widens and connects to a vast mountain plateau, its tall mountain grasses waving in the breeze. The old road, or what's left of it, takes a steep decline to the west as it hugs the side of the nearly vertical mountain slope. In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: southwest.

A warm glow begins to form about Fionna, bathing the area in a peaceful white light.

You follow Clive south...


l
The area brightens.
[Highland Road Village Ruins.]

To the north, the remains of an ancient village open up before you. Only stone foundations and piles of rubble remain to mark that the village ever existed. Wild, thorny scrubs grow everywhere. The ground slopes steeply downhill to the south. The river flows out from behind a large mound to the west and disappears into the distance.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* northeast east southeast west northwest.
[Highland Road Village Ruins.]

To the north, the remains of an ancient village open up before you. Only stone foundations and piles of rubble remain to mark that the village ever existed. Wild, thorny scrubs grow everywhere. This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast west northwest.

[Highland Road.]

The Darkith cuts deep into the ground as it flows downhill to the south. Steep ridges have formed on both sides of the river. They block a great deal of the sounds of the river's wrath, and much of the teaming life within the forest to the east can be heard.

[Highland Road.]

The rotting corpse of a Flerian hangs by its neck from beneath a thick branch. Smaller creatures have been feasting on the remains, and the stench turns your stomach. The river continues to flow downhill along the west side of the road, unchanged for thousands of years.

This area is illuminated.

[Highland Road.]

The ground slopes uphill to the north, and flattens out toward the south. The ancient stones of Highland Road, neglected for untold ages, act as a barrier between the forest and the river. [Highland Road.]

Tall trees block your view of the mountains. Suddenly, you hear the death yell of some forest creature, and the tearing of flesh, caused by the jaws of a larger forest creature. You must be close to the source of those grisly sounds, or they would have been drowned out by the raging river waters. The thick wood hides the animals.

This area is illuminated.

[Highland Road.]

A charred circle of stones lies in a spot to the side of the road. Worn smooth rocks sit a comfortable distance from where the fire would be located. All the underbrush has been cleared from of the area. For an untold number of years, this site has been a favorite place for travelers to make camp for the night.

[Highland Road.]

The ancient trail extends north toward the looming heights of the Great Divide. This close to the mountains, many breathtaking details can be seen. Lush forests growing on the lower slopes contrast with stark white icy caps. The river flowing south turns westward, and the road curves to follow its bank and avoid a thick clump of trees.

The area brightens.
[Highland Road.]

The forest to the east seems to press against you along this stretch of road. Branches and hanging vines require anyone tall to hunch over as they pass underneath.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

[Highland Road.]

The road slopes steeply uphill to the south. Hazy with distance, the rough peaks of the Great Divide poke above the horizon far to the north. The fast moving river runs parallel to the road. Its pace drowns out any noises from the animals and birds living in the tall trees to the east.

The area brightens.
[Highland Road, Tower Ruins.]

The remains of a stone tower stand at the top of the hill near the road. Much of the bottom floor still stands, but the rest lies as scattered rubble. The roaring Darkith flows from the north and around the hill to the southwest. On the other side of the river tall grasslands stretch out as far as the eye can see. This high vantage point also offers a breathtaking view of the forest to the west.  A doorway is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a glowing multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* south.

The area brightens.
[Highland Road.]

The ruins of an old stone tower lie to the north, at the edge of the hilltop. The river curves around the large broad hill, flowing towards the corner of Spur's outer walls to the southwest. On the other side of the river, more squat hills dot the ground north of the city. A broad, flat grassland stretches from those low hills to the distant, barely visible peaks of the Great Divide.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a glowing multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* south.

[Highland Road.]

Little in the way of vegetation clings to the top of this broad hill. From this vantage, you have an excellent view of the surrounding terrain. A vast forest stretches to the east, extending as far as the eye can see. A gigantic river flows down from the hazy mountains of the Great Divide far to the north. The outer walls of the city of Spur stand sentry to the southwest.

The area brightens.
[Highland Road.]

Trees and brush close in on what remains of the ancient road, as if trying to choke it to death. The Darkith River rumbles deeply nearby, continuously announcing its presence and nearly drowning out the sounds of the local wildlife. The road begins to climb a steep hill to the northwest, while becoming more level to the south.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a glowing multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: south northwest*.

The area brightens.
[Highland Road.]

A broken down cart lies off to the side, its wheel broken many years ago. There is no sign of what cargo it once might have carried, but it would be safe to assume that it was a merchant's wagon by the size of it. Apparently, there once was a good system of trade between Spur and whatever lies to the north.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a glowing multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.

The area brightens.
[Highland Road.]

Tall trees and thick brush hide the mighty Darkith from view, but does little to dull the powerful roar of the nearby river. The trail curves around an unmovable boulder that looks to be bigger than three Thugians put together. A regal golden eagle looks down from its nest high in the branches of one of the trees overlooking the road.

This area is illuminated.

[Eastern Housing.]

l
The area brightens.
[Eastern Housing.]

Thankfully the air here is a little clearer, although the sights are not any better. A few feet away two hungry Thugians are fighting over the corpse of a dead rabid dog. They stop long enough to glance your way, look back at the dog's corpse, and then stare thoughtfully at each other - well, as thoughtful as a Thugian can be. They lumber to their feet and start heading your way, but halfway to you they start fighting with each other. You decide this is a good moment to move along quickly. 

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a glowing multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: northeast* east southwest.
[Eastern Housing.]

Thankfully the air here is a little clearer, although the sights are not any better. A few feet away two hungry Thugians are fighting over the corpse of a dead rabid dog. They stop long enough to glance your way, look back at the dog's corpse, and then stare thoughtfully at each other - well, as thoughtful as a Thugian can be. They lumber to their feet and start heading your way, but halfway to you they start fighting with each other. You decide this is a good moment to move along quickly.

[Eastern Housing.]

The ramshackle huts give way to patched and faded tents along this portion of the path. [Eastern Spur Road.]

A large, well-kept gate is cut into the immense wall that surrounds Spur. Although everything else has fallen into disrepair, it is evident that security is still of foremost importance to the Governor. Uniformed guards patrol high above, conscientiously glancing down to assure peace is being kept along this well-traveled road. [Eastern Spur Road.]

A large, stubborn dog has resolutely planted himself in the middle of the road. His master pulls on the rope around his neck, then pushes his backside firmly. It is quite apparent that nothing short of a nice meaty bone is going to make him budge. Those who travel this path keep their heads lowered and ignore the comical scene. A gnawing hunger and aching muscles after a long day of hard work keep most from paying attention to even the simple things around them.

[Eastern Spur Road.]

Huge, colorful silk banners float proudly in the breeze from the giant stone arch that provides passage to the reopened Spurian Arena. The gladiators that once sat dejected and forlorn against the arch now stand proudly and alert, polishing their swords to the highest sheen, and adjusting their helms and breastplates. A long line of potential competitors and audience members alike is beginning to form, the last of whom glance uneasily in the direction of the looming cemetary before turning their attention back on the huge arena ahead.  An open iron gate and a stone arch are here.

[Town Square Center.]

A beautiful fountain, sculpted from pristine white marble, rests at the center of Spur's main square. Clear, sparkling water sprays from a spout at the fountain's tip and cascades down several tiers before spilling into a circular pool. High above the square, the wings of two imperial stone dragons form an arch for a massive gateway. The colossal monument stands at the heart of the city like a silent sentinel keeping watch over the entire realm. Lifelike marble statues decorate the square's perimeter, each a celebrated hero of Spur's past.   A flowing white marble fountain, some crystal flecked granite oliphant-shaped benches, a marble statue of a Human, a crumbled marble statue of a Dragon, and a rosewood sign are here.

Many people crowd the narrow Bazaar Path, either heading towards the infamous Bazaar, or forcing their way back towards Trade Way. [Food Way.]

At this intersection many stands display their exotic foodstuffs. Hanging from large hooks are various unidentifiable hunks of meat, and vegetables of all shapes and colors. The only thing more prevalent than the merchants and buyers are the bugs, who clamor to find the most pungent item to land on. To the northeast a small tent can barely be seen hiding behind the stalls.  A white silk tent and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a glowing multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.

You follow Clive south...

[The Bazaar.]

Moving into the heart of the Bazaar, you encounter a more established shop. The building is sturdier, and built for long term occupancy. The general store has a steady stream of customers, and it serves those young adventurers who are in need of supplies.  A weathered wooden sign, an open faded chestnut door, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a glowing multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* south*.

You follow Clive south...

[The Bazaar.]

Guards stand before each stall at this intersection, on what has come to be known as Jeweler's Row. Crowds of customers vie for the finest stones and most beautiful gems. All different manner of merchants hawk their wares as those you should buy. Those who are not careful are just as liable to walk away with a sparkly piece of glass as an expensive diamond.  A bright vellum sign, an open stall, and a street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Fionna the Noble Secian, Clive the Noble Drag-al, Arion the Secian (holding a glowing multicolored swirling magick sphere), and Lewelin the Usil Elf.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
